meanings.definition: A painful area of skin that is damaged from lying in bed for a long time.
meanings.sent1: The nurse carefully checked the patient's back for any signs of a bedsore.
meanings.sent2: Healing a bedsore requires proper medical attention and frequent repositioning.
meanings.sent3: The bedsore on the elderly man's hip was so itchy, he joked about it being a new kind of tattoo.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting self-care can lead to emotional bedsore that is as painful as a physical one.
meanings.sent5: The vivid red color of the bedsore served as a stark reminder of the importance of movement.

meanings.sent1: Without proper care, patients may bedsore due to prolonged immobility.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to prevent the skin from bedsoring by changing positions regularly.
meanings.sent3: The lack of awareness about the risk factors can cause someone to bedsore unknowingly.
meanings.sent4: Her laziness caused her to bedsore, prompting her to be more mindful of her health.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's coach warned him that overtraining could make him bedsore and affect his performance.
